   19: %%
   20: -module(warnings_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %%-define(STANDALONE, true).
   23: 
   24: -ifdef(STANDALONE).
   25: -define(line, put(line, ?LINE), ).
   26: -define(config(X,Y), foo).
   27: -define(privdir, "warnings_SUITE_priv").
   28: -define(t, test_server).
   29: -else.
   30: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   31: -define(datadir, proplists:get_value(data_dir, Conf)).
   32: -define(privdir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Conf)).
   33: -endif.
   34: 
   35: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   36: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   37: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2]).
   38: 
   39: -export([pattern/1,pattern2/1,pattern3/1,pattern4/1,
   40: 	 guard/1,bad_arith/1,bool_cases/1,bad_apply/1,
   41:          files/1,effect/1,bin_opt_info/1,bin_construction/1,
   42: 	 comprehensions/1,maps/1,maps_bin_opt_info/1,
   43:          redundant_boolean_clauses/1,
   44: 	 underscore/1,no_warnings/1,
   45: 	 bit_syntax/1,inlining/1,tuple_calls/1,
   46:          recv_opt_info/1,opportunistic_warnings/1,
   47:          eep49/1,inline_list_funcs/1]).
   48: 
   49: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   50:     Config.
   51: 
   52: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   53:     ok.
   54: 
   55: suite() ->
   56:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   57:      {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   58: 
   59: all() -> 
   60:     [{group,p}].
   61: 
   62: groups() -> 
   63:     [{p,test_lib:parallel(),
   64:       [pattern,pattern2,pattern3,pattern4,guard,
   65:        bad_arith,bool_cases,bad_apply,files,effect,
   66:        bin_opt_info,bin_construction,comprehensions,maps,
   67:        maps_bin_opt_info,
   68:        redundant_boolean_clauses,
   69:        underscore,no_warnings,bit_syntax,inlining,
   70:        tuple_calls,recv_opt_info,opportunistic_warnings,
   71:        eep49,inline_list_funcs]}].
   72: 
   73: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   74:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   75:     Config.
   76: 
   77: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   78:     ok.
   79: 
   80: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   81:     Config.
   82: 
   83: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   84:     Config.
   85: 
   86: 
   87: pattern(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   88:     %% Test warnings generated by v3_core.
   89:     Ts = [{pattern,
   90:            <<"%% Just a comment here.
   91:               f(a={glurf,2}=A) -> A.
   92: 
   93:               g(A) ->
   94:                  case A of
   95:                    a=[_|_] -> error;
   96:                    Other -> true
   97:                  end.
   98: 
   99:               foo(X) ->
  100:                  a = {nisse,b} = X.
  101:            ">>,
  102:            [warn_unused_vars],
  103:            {warnings,
  104:             [{{2,15},v3_core,{nomatch,pattern}},
  105:              {{6,20},v3_core,{nomatch,pattern}}
  106:             ]}}],
  107:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  108:     ok.
  109: 
  110: pattern2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  111:     %% Test warnings generated by sys_core_fold.
  112:     %% If we disable Core Erlang optimizations, we expect that
  113:     %% beam_core_to_ssa should generate some of the warnings.
  114:     Source = <<"f(A) -> ok;
  115:                 f(B) -> error.
  116:                 t(A, B, C) ->
  117:                   case {A,B,C} of
  118:                     {a,B} -> ok;
  119:                     {_,B} -> ok
  120:                   end.
  121:                 c(E) ->
  122:                   case E of
  123:                     _ -> ok;
  124:                     _ -> ok
  125:                   end.
  126:            ">>,
  127: 
  128:     %% Test warnings from sys_core_fold.
  129:     Ts = [{pattern2,
  130: 	   Source,
  131: 	   [nowarn_unused_vars],
  132:            {warnings,[{{2,17},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{shadow,1,{f,1}}}},
  133:                       {{4,19},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,no_clause}},
  134:                       {{5,21},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,clause_type}},
  135:                       {{6,21},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,clause_type}},
  136:                       {{11,21},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{shadow,10}}}
  137:                      ]}}],
  138:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  139: 
  140:     %% Disable Core Erlang optimizations. beam_core_to_ssa should produce
  141:     %% a warning for the clause that didn't match.
  142:     Ts2 = [{pattern2,
  143: 	    Source,
  144: 	    [nowarn_unused_vars,no_copt],
  145: 	    {warnings,
  146: 	     [{{2,17},beam_core_to_ssa,{nomatch,{shadow,1}}},
  147:               {{11,21},beam_core_to_ssa,{nomatch,{shadow,10}}}
  148:              ]}}],
  149:     [] = run(Config, Ts2),
  150:     ok.
  151: 
  152: pattern3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  153:     %% Test warnings generated by the pattern matching compiler
  154:     %% in beam_core_to_ssa.
  155: 
  156:     Ts = [{pattern3,
  157: 	   <<"
  158:             f({A,_}) -> {ok,A};
  159:             f([_|_]=B) -> {ok,B};
  160:             f({urk,nisse}) -> urka_glurka.
  161:             word(<<\"AND\">>) -> <<\"and\">>;
  162:             word(<<\"AS\">>) -> <<\"as\">>;
  163:             word(<<\"A\">>) -> <<\"a\">>;
  164:             word(<<\"AS\">>) -> <<\"as\">>.
  165:            ">>,
  166: 	   [nowarn_unused_vars],
  167: 	   {warnings,
  168:             [{{4,13},beam_core_to_ssa,{nomatch,{shadow,2}}},
  169:              {{8,13},beam_core_to_ssa,{nomatch,{shadow,6}}}]}}],
  170:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  171: 
  172:     ok.
  173: 
  174: pattern4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  175:     %% Test warnings for clauses that cannot possibly match.
  176: 
  177:     Ts = [{pattern4,
  178: 	   <<"
  179:              t() ->
  180:                case true of 
  181:                  false -> a;
  182:                  true -> b
  183:                end.
  184: 
  185:              fi() ->
  186:                case true of 
  187:                  false -> a;
  188:                  false -> b
  189:                end,
  190:                case true of 
  191:                  true -> a;
  192:                  true -> b;
  193:                  X -> X
  194:                end,
  195:                case boolean of 
  196:                  true -> a;
  197:                  false -> b
  198:                end.
  199:              int() ->
  200:                case 42 of
  201:                  [a|b] -> no;
  202:                  <<1>> -> no;
  203:                  <<X>> -> no;
  204:                  17 -> no;
  205:                  [] -> no;
  206:                  a -> no;
  207:                  {a,b,c} -> no
  208:                end.
  209:              tuple() ->
  210:                case {x,y,z} of
  211:                  \"xyz\" -> no;
  212:                  [a|b] -> no;
  213:                  <<1>> -> no;
  214:                  <<X>> -> no;
  215:                  17 -> no;
  216:                  [] -> no;
  217:                  a -> no;
  218:                  {a,b,c} -> no;
  219:                  {x,y} -> no
  220:                end.
  221:            ">>,
  222: 	   [nowarn_unused_vars],
  223: 	   {warnings,
  224:             [{{9,16},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,no_clause}},
  225:              {{11,18},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,shadow}},
  226:              {{15,18},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,shadow}},
  227:              {{18,16},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,no_clause}},
  228:              {{23,16},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,no_clause}},
  229:              {{33,16},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,no_clause}}
  230: 	    ]}}],
  231:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  232: 
  233:     ok.
  234: 
  235: guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  236:     %% Test warnings for false guards.
  237: 
  238:     Ts = [{guard,
  239: 	   <<"
  240:               t(A, B) when element(x, dum) -> ok.
  241: 
  242:               tt(A, B) when 1 == 2 -> ok.
  243: 
  244:               ttt() when element(x, dum) -> ok.
  245: 
  246:               t4(T, F) when element({F}, T) -> ok.
  247:               t5(T, F) when element([F], T) -> ok.
  248:               t6(Pos, F) when element(Pos, [F]) -> ok.
  249:               t7(Pos) when element(Pos, []) -> ok.
  250:            ">>,
  251: 	   [nowarn_unused_vars],
  252: 	   {warnings,
  253:             [{{2,28},sys_core_fold,
  254:               {failed,{eval_failure,
  255:                        {erlang,element,2},
  256:                        badarg}}},
  257:              {{4,15},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,guard}},
  258:              {{4,15},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,no_clause}},
  259:              {{6,26},sys_core_fold,
  260:               {failed,
  261:                {eval_failure,
  262:                 {erlang,element,2},
  263:                 badarg}}}
  264: 	    ]}}],
  265:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  266: 
  267:     ok.
  268: 
  269: bad_arith(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  270:     Ts = [{bad_arith,
  271:            <<"f() ->
  272:                 if
  273:                   a + 3 > 3 -> ok;
  274:                  true -> error
  275:               end.
  276: 
  277:               g(A) ->
  278:                 if
  279:                   is_integer(A), a + 3 > 3 -> ok;
  280:                   a + 3 > 42, is_integer(A) -> ok;
  281:                  true -> error
  282:               end.
  283: 
  284:               h(A) ->
  285:                 a + 3 + A.
  286:            ">>,
  287: 	   [],
  288: 	   {warnings,
  289:             [{{3,21},sys_core_fold,
  290:               {failed,{eval_failure,
  291:                        {erlang,'+',2},
  292:                        badarith}}},
  293:              {{9,36},sys_core_fold,
  294:               {failed,{eval_failure,
  295:                        {erlang,'+',2},
  296:                        badarith}}},
  297:              {{10,21},sys_core_fold,
  298:               {failed,{eval_failure,
  299:                        {erlang,'+',2},
  300:                        badarith}}},
  301:              {{15,19},sys_core_fold,
  302:               {failed,{eval_failure,
  303:                        {erlang,'+',2},
  304:                        badarith}}}
  305: 	    ] }}],
  306:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  307:     ok.
  308: 
  309: bool_cases(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  310:     Ts = [{bool_cases,
  311: 	   <<"
  312:             f(A, B) ->
  313:                case A > B of
  314:                  true -> true;
  315:                  false -> false;
  316:                  Other -> {error,not_bool}
  317:                end.
  318: 
  319:             g(A, B) ->
  320:                case A =/= B of
  321:                  false -> false;
  322:                  true -> true;
  323:                  Other -> {error,not_bool}
  324:                end.
  325: 
  326:             h(Bool) ->
  327:                case not Bool of
  328:                  maybe -> strange;
  329:                  false -> ok;
  330:                  true -> error
  331:                end.
  332:            ">>,
  333:            [nowarn_unused_vars],
  334:            {warnings,
  335:             [{{6,18},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,shadow}},
  336:              {{13,18},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,shadow}},
  337:              {{18,18},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,clause_type}} ]} }],
  338:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  339:     ok.
  340: 
  341: bad_apply(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  342:     Ts = [{bad_apply,
  343: 	   <<"
  344:              t(1) -> 42:42();
  345:              t(2) -> erlang:42();
  346:              t(3) -> 42:start();
  347:              t(4) -> []:start();
  348:              t(5) -> erlang:[]();
  349:              t(6) -> [a,b,c]().
  350:            ">>,
  351:            [],
  352:            {warnings,
  353:             [{{2,22},beam_core_to_ssa,{failed,bad_call}},
  354:              {{3,22},beam_core_to_ssa,{failed,bad_call}},
  355:              {{4,22},beam_core_to_ssa,{failed,bad_call}},
  356:              {{5,22},beam_core_to_ssa,{failed,bad_call}},
  357:              {{6,22},beam_core_to_ssa,{failed,bad_call}},
  358:              {{7,22},sys_core_fold,{failed,bad_call}}
  359:             ]}}],
  360:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  361: 
  362:     %% Also verify that the generated code generates the correct error.
  363:     try erlang:42() of
  364: 	      _ -> ct:fail(should_fail)
  365: 	  catch
  366: 	      error:badarg -> ok
  367: 	  end,
  368:     ok.
  369: 
  370: files(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  371:     Ts = [{files_1,
  372: 	   <<"
  373:               -file(\"file1\", 14).
  374: 
  375:               t1() ->
  376:                   1/0.
  377: 
  378:               -file(\"file2\", 7).
  379: 
  380:               t2() ->
  381:                   1/0.
  382:            ">>,
  383:            [],
  384:            {warnings,
  385:             [{"file1",[{{17,20},sys_core_fold,
  386:                         {failed,{eval_failure,
  387:                                  {erlang,'/',2},
  388:                                  badarith}}}]},
  389:              {"file2",[{{10,20},sys_core_fold,
  390:                         {failed,{eval_failure,
  391:                                  {erlang,'/',2},
  392:                                  badarith}}}]}]}}],
  393: 
  394:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  395:     ok.
  396: 
  397: %% Test warnings for term construction and BIF calls in effect context.
  398: effect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  399:     Ts = [{no_warnings,
  400:            %% No warnings should be generated in the following functions.
  401:            <<"
  402:              m1(X, Sz) ->
  403:                 if
  404:                   Sz =:= 0 -> X = 0;
  405:                   true -> ok
  406:                 end,
  407:                 ok.
  408: 
  409:              m2(X, Sz) ->
  410:                 if
  411:                   Sz =:= 0 -> X = {a,Sz};
  412:                   true -> ok
  413:                 end,
  414:                 ok.
  415: 
  416:              m3(X, Sz) ->
  417:                 if
  418:                   Sz =:= 0 -> X = [a,Sz];
  419:                   true -> ok
  420:                 end,
  421:                 ok.
  422: 
  423:              m4(X, Sz, Var) ->
  424:                 if
  425:                   Sz =:= 0 -> X = Var;
  426:                   true -> ok
  427:                 end,
  428:                 ok.
  429: 
  430:              m5(X, Sz) ->
  431:                 if
  432:                    Sz =:= 0 -> X = {a,b,c};
  433:                    true -> ok
  434:                 end,
  435:                 ok.
  436: 
  437:              m6(X, Sz) ->
  438:                 if
  439:                   Sz =:= 0 -> X = {a,Sz,[1,2,3]};
  440:                   true -> ok
  441:                 end,
  442:                 ok.
  443: 
  444:              m7(X, Sz) ->
  445:                 if
  446:                   Sz =:= 0 -> X = {a,Sz,[1,2,3],abs(Sz)};
  447:                   true -> ok
  448:                 end,
  449:                 ok.
  450: 
  451:              m8(A, B) ->
  452:                 case {A,B} of
  453:                   V -> V
  454:                 end,
  455:                 ok.
  456: 
  457:              m9(Bs) ->
  458:                 [{B,ok} = {B,foo:bar(B)} || B <- Bs],
  459:                 ok.
  460: 
  461:              m10(ConfigTableSize) ->
  462:                case ConfigTableSize of
  463:                  apa ->
  464:                    CurrentConfig = {id(camel_phase3),id(sms)},
  465:                    case CurrentConfig of
  466:                      {apa, bepa} -> ok;
  467:                      _ -> ok
  468:                    end
  469:                end,
  470:                ok.
  471: 
  472:              id(I) -> I.
  473:              ">>,
  474:            [],[]},
  475: 
  476:           {basic,
  477:            <<"
  478:              t(X) ->
  479:                case X of
  480:                 warn_lc ->
  481:                     [is_integer(Z) || Z <- [1,2,3]];
  482:                 warn_lc_2 ->
  483:                     [{error,Z} || Z <- [1,2,3]];
  484:                 warn_lc_3 ->
  485:                     [{error,abs(Z)} || Z <- [1,2,3]];
  486:                 no_warn_lc ->
  487:                     [put(last_integer, Z) || Z <- [1,2,3]]; %no warning
  488:                 unused_tuple_literal ->
  489:                     {a,b,c};
  490:                 unused_list_literal ->
  491:                     [1,2,3,4];
  492:                 unused_integer ->
  493:                     42;
  494:                 unused_arith ->
  495:                     X*X
  496:                end,
  497:                ok.
  498:              ">>,
  499:            [],
  500:            {warnings,[{{5,22},sys_core_fold,{ignored,{no_effect,{erlang,is_integer,1}}}},
  501:                       {{7,22},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}},
  502:                       {{9,22},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}},
  503:                       {{9,29},sys_core_fold,{ignored,{result,{erlang,abs,1}}}},
  504:                       {{13,21},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}},
  505:                       {{15,21},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}},
  506:                       {{17,21},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}},
  507:                       {{19,22},sys_core_fold,{ignored,{result, {erlang,'*',2}}}}
  508:                      ]}},
  509: 
  510:           {nested,
  511:             <<"
  512:              t(X) ->
  513:                case X of
  514:                 nested ->
  515:                     [{ok,node(),module:foo(),self(),[time(),date()],time()},
  516:                      is_integer(X)];
  517:                 unused_bit_syntax ->
  518:                     <<X:8>>;
  519:                 unused_fun ->
  520:                     fun() -> {ok,X} end;
  521:                 unused_named_fun ->
  522:                     fun F(0) -> 1;
  523:                         F(N) -> N*F(N-1)
  524:                     end;
  525:                 unused_atom ->
  526:                     ignore;                             %no warning
  527:                 unused_nil ->
  528:                     [];                                 %no warning
  529:                 comp_op ->
  530:                     X =:= 2;
  531:                 cookie ->
  532:                     erlang:get_cookie();
  533:                 result_ignore ->
  534:                     _ = list_to_integer(X);
  535:                 warn_lc_4 ->
  536:                     %% No warning because of assignment to _.
  537:                     [_ = abs(Z) || Z <- [1,2,3]]
  538:                end,
  539:                ok.
  540:              ">>,
  541:            [],
  542:            {warnings,[{{5,21},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}},
  543:                       {{5,26},sys_core_fold,{ignored,{no_effect,{erlang,node,0}}}},
  544:                       {{5,46},sys_core_fold,{ignored,{no_effect,{erlang,self,0}}}},
  545:                       {{5,54},sys_core_fold,{ignored,{no_effect,{erlang,time,0}}}},
  546:                       {{5,61},sys_core_fold,{ignored,{no_effect,{erlang,date,0}}}},
  547:                       {{5,69},sys_core_fold,{ignored,{no_effect,{erlang,time,0}}}},
  548:                       {{6,22},sys_core_fold,{ignored,{no_effect,{erlang,is_integer,1}}}},
  549:                       {{8,21},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}},
  550:                       {{10,21},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}},
  551:                       {{12,21},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}},
  552:                       {{20,23},sys_core_fold,{ignored,{no_effect,{erlang,'=:=',2}}}},
  553:                       {{22,21},sys_core_fold,{ignored,{no_effect,{erlang,get_cookie,0}}}}
  554:                       ]}},
  555: 
  556:           {seq,
  557:            <<"
  558:              t(T) ->
  559:                [ {a,b,T} ],  [ {x,y,T} ],
  560:                ok.
  561:              ">>,
  562:            [],
  563:            {warnings,[{{3,16},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}},
  564:                       {{3,30},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}}]}},
  565: 
  566:           {propagated_literal,
  567:            <<"
  568:             foo(X) ->
  569:                 Y = [$.],
  570:                 %% There must not be a warning for constructing a term that
  571:                 %% is never used.
  572:                 fun() -> X = Y ++ [$.] end(),
  573:                 ok.
  574:              ">>,
  575:            [],
  576:            []}
  577:          ],
  578:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  579:     ok.
  580: 
  581: bin_opt_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  582:     Code = <<"
  583:              t1(Bin) ->
  584:                case Bin of
  585:                  _ when byte_size(Bin) > 20 -> erlang:error(too_long);
  586:                  <<_,T/binary>> -> t1(T);
  587:                  <<>> -> ok
  588:              end.
  589: 
  590:              %% We use a tail in a BIF instruction, remote call, function
  591:              %% return, and an optimizable tail call for better coverage.
  592:              t2(<<A,B,T/bytes>>) ->
  593:                  if
  594:                      A > B -> t2(T);
  595:                      A =< B -> T
  596:                  end;
  597:              t2(<<_,T/bytes>>) when byte_size(T) < 4 ->
  598:                  foo;
  599:              t2(<<_,T/bytes>>) ->
  600:                  split_binary(T, 4).
  601:            ">>,
  602: 
  603:     Ws = (catch run_test(Config, Code, [bin_opt_info])),
  604: 
  605:     %% This is an inexact match since the pass reports exact instructions as
  606:     %% part of the warnings, which may include annotations that vary from run
  607:     %% to run.
  608:     {warnings,
  609:      [{5,beam_ssa_bsm,{unsuitable_call,
  610:                        {{b_local,{b_literal,t1},1},
  611:                         {used_before_match,
  612:                          {b_set,_,_,{bif,byte_size},[_]}}}}},
  613:       {5,beam_ssa_bsm,{binary_created,_,_}},
  614:       {11,beam_ssa_bsm,{binary_created,_,_}}, %% A =< B -> T
  615:       {13,beam_ssa_bsm,context_reused},       %% A > B -> t2(T);
  616:       {16,beam_ssa_bsm,{binary_created,_,_}}, %% when byte_size(T) < 4 ->
  617:       {19,beam_ssa_bsm,{remote_call,
  618:                         {b_remote,
  619:                          {b_literal,erlang},
  620:                          {b_literal,split_binary},2}}},
  621:       {19,beam_ssa_bsm,{binary_created,_,_}}  %% split_binary(T, 4)
  622:      ]} = Ws,
  623: 
  624:     %% For coverage: don't give the bin_opt_info option.
  625:     [] = (catch run_test(Config, Code, [])),
  626: 
  627:     %% Now try with abstract code and no location.
  628:     %%
  629:     %% t1(Bin) ->
  630:     %%   case Bin of
  631:     %%     _ when byte_size(Bin) > 20 -> erlang:error(too_long);
  632:     %%     <<_,T/binary>> -> t1(T);
  633:     %%     <<>> -> ok
  634:     %% end.
  635:     Forms = [{attribute,0,module,nolocation_binary},
  636:              {attribute,0,export,[{t1,1}]},
  637:              {function,0,t1,1,
  638:                 [{clause,0,[{var,0,'Bin'}],[],
  639:                      [{'case',0,{var,0,'Bin'},
  640:                           [{clause,0,
  641:                                [{var,0,'_'}],
  642:                                [[{op,0,'>',
  643:                                      {call,0,{atom,0,byte_size},[{var,0,'Bin'}]},
  644:                                      {integer,0,20}}]],
  645:                                [{call,0,
  646:                                     {remote,0,{atom,0,erlang},{atom,0,error}},
  647:                                     [{atom,0,too_long}]}]},
  648:                            {clause,0,
  649:                                [{bin,0,
  650:                                     [{bin_element,0,{var,0,'_'},default,default},
  651:                                      {bin_element,0,{var,0,'T'},default,[binary]}]}],
  652:                                [],
  653:                                [{call,0,{atom,0,t1},[{var,0,'T'}]}]},
  654:                            {clause,0,[{bin,0,[]}],[],[{atom,0,ok}]}]}]}]}],
  655:     Wsf = (catch run_forms(Forms, [bin_opt_info])),
  656: 
  657:     {warnings,
  658:      [{none,beam_ssa_bsm,{unsuitable_call,
  659:                        {{b_local,{b_literal,t1},1},
  660:                         {used_before_match,
  661:                          {b_set,_,_,{bif,byte_size},[_]}}}}},
  662:       {none,beam_ssa_bsm,{binary_created,_,_}}
  663:      ]} = Wsf,
  664: 
  665:     ok.
  666: 
  667: bin_construction(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  668:     Ts = [{bin_construction,
  669: 	   <<"
  670:              t() ->
  671:                  Bin = <<1,2,3>>,
  672:                  <<Bin:4/binary>>.
  673: 
  674:              x() ->
  675:                  Bin = <<1,2,3,7:4>>,
  676:                  <<Bin/binary>>.
  677: 
  678:              y() -> <<0.5>>.
  679:              z() -> <<99999999999999/utf8>>.
  680:              w() -> <<0.5:1/float>>.
  681: 
  682:              a() ->
  683:                Size = bad_size,
  684:                <<1:Size>>.
  685:            ">>,
  686:            [],
  687:            {warnings,[{{4,18},sys_core_fold,{failed,embedded_binary_size}},
  688:                       {{8,18},sys_core_fold,{failed,{embedded_unit,8,28}}},
  689:                       {{10,21},v3_core,{failed,bad_binary}},
  690:                       {{11,21},sys_core_fold,{failed,bad_unicode}},
  691:                       {{12,21},sys_core_fold,{failed,bad_float_size}},
  692:                       {{16,18},beam_core_to_ssa,{failed,bad_segment_size}}
  693:                      ]}}],
  694:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  695: 
  696:     ok.

  708: maps(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  709:     Ts = [{bad_map,
  710:            <<"
  711:              t() ->
  712:                  case maybe_map of
  713:                      #{} -> ok;
  714:                      not_map -> error
  715:                  end.
  716:              x() ->
  717:                  case true of
  718:                      #{}  -> error;
  719:                      true -> ok
  720:                  end.
  721:            ">>,
  722:            [],
  723:            {warnings,[{{3,18},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,no_clause}},
  724:                       {{9,22},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,clause_type}}]}},
  725: 	   {bad_map_src1,
  726:            <<"
  727:              t() ->
  728:                  M = {a,[]},
  729:                  {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch(M#{ a => 1 })),
  730:                  ok.
  731:            ">>,
  732:            [],
  733:            {warnings,[{{4,48},sys_core_fold,{failed,bad_map_update}}]}},
  734: 	   {bad_map_src2,
  735:            <<"
  736:              t() ->
  737: 		 M = id({a,[]}),
  738: 		 {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch(M#{ a => 1})),
  739: 		 ok.
  740: 	     id(I) -> I.
  741:            ">>,
  742: 	   [inline],
  743: 	    []},
  744: 	   {bad_map_src3,
  745:            <<"
  746:              t() ->
  747:                  {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<>>#{ a := 1}),
  748:                  ok.
  749:            ">>,
  750:            [],
  751:            {warnings,[{{3,51},sys_core_fold,{failed,bad_map_update}}]}},
  752:            {ok_map_literal_key,
  753:            <<"
  754:              t() ->
  755: 		 V = id(1),
  756: 		 M = id(#{ <<$h,$i>> => V }),
  757: 		 V = case M of
  758: 		    #{ <<0:257>> := Val } -> Val;
  759: 		    #{ <<$h,$i>> := Val } -> Val
  760: 		 end,
  761: 		 ok.
  762: 	     id(I) -> I.
  763:            ">>,
  764:            [],
  765: 	   []},
  766:            {repeated_keys1,
  767:            <<"
  768:              foo1() ->
  769:                  #{a=>1,
  770:                    b=> 2,
  771:                    a=>3}.
  772:              
  773:              bar1(M) ->
  774:                  M#{a=>1, b=> 2, a:=3}.
  775:              
  776:              baz1(M) ->
  777:                  M#{a=>1, b=> 2, a:=3}.
  778:              
  779:              foo2() ->
  780:                  #{\"a\"=>1, \"b\"=> 2, \"a\"=>3}.
  781:              
  782:              bar2(M) ->
  783:                  M#{\"a\"=>1, \"b\"=> 2, \"a\":=3}.
  784:              
  785:              baz2(M) ->
  786:                  M#{\"a\"=>1, \"b\"=> 2, \"a\":=3}.
  787:              
  788:              foo3() ->
  789:                  #{\"a\"=>1,
  790:                    \"b\"=> 2,
  791:                    \"a\"=>3}.
  792:              
  793:              bar3(M) ->
  794:                  M#{\"a\"=>1, \"b\"=> 2, \"a\":=3}.
  795:              
  796:              baz3(M) ->
  797:                  M#{<<\"a\">>=>1, <<\"b\">>=> 2, <<\"a\">>:=3}.
  798:            ">>,
  799:            [],
  800:            {warnings,[{{3,20},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,a}},
  801:                       {{8,21},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,a}},
  802:                       {{11,21},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,a}},
  803:                       {{14,20},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,"a"}},
  804:                       {{17,21},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,"a"}},
  805:                       {{20,21},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,"a"}},
  806:                       {{23,20},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,"a"}},
  807:                       {{28,21},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,"a"}},
  808:                       {{31,21},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,<<"a">>}}
  809:                      ]}},
  810:            {repeated_keys2,
  811:            <<"
  812:              foo4(K) ->
  813:                  #{\"a\"=>1, K => 1, \"b\"=> 2, \"a\"=>3, K=>2}.
  814:              
  815:              bar4(M,K) ->
  816:                  M#{a=>1, K =>1, b=> 2, a:=3, K=>2}.
  817:              
  818:              baz4(M,K) ->
  819:                  M#{<<\"a\">>=>1,
  820:                      K => 1, <<\"b\">>=> 2,
  821:                      <<\"a\">>:=3, K=>2}.
  822:              
  823:              foo5(K) ->
  824:                  #{{\"a\",1}=>1, K => 1, \"b\"=> 2, {\"a\",1}=>3, K=>2}.
  825:              
  826:              bar5(M,K) ->
  827:                  M#{{\"a\",<<\"b\">>}=>1, K =>1,
  828:                     \"b\"=> 2, {\"a\",<<\"b\">>}:=3, K=>2}.
  829:              
  830:              baz5(M,K) ->
  831:                  M#{{<<\"a\">>,1}=>1, K => 1,
  832:                     <<\"b\">>=> 2, {<<\"a\">>,1}:=3,K=>2}.
  833:              
  834:              foo6(K) ->
  835:                  #{#{\"a\"=>1}=>1, K => 1, \"b\"=> 2, #{\"a\"=>1}=>3, K=>2}.
  836:              
  837:              bar6(M,K) ->
  838:                  M#{#{\"a\"=><<\"b\">>}=>1, K =>1,
  839:                     \"b\"=> 2, #{\"a\"=><<\"b\">>}:=3, K=>2}.
  840:              
  841:              baz6(M,K) ->
  842:                  M#{#{<<\"a\">>=>1}=>1,
  843:                     K => 1,
  844:                     <<\"b\">>=> 2,
  845:                     #{<<\"a\">>=>1}:=3,K=>2}.
  846:              
  847:              foo7(K) ->
  848:                  M1 = #{#{\"a\"=>1}=>1, K => 1, \"b\"=> 2},
  849:                  M1#{#{\"a\"=>1}=>3, K=>2}.
  850:              
  851:              bar7(M,K) ->
  852:                  M1 = M#{#{\"a\"=><<\"b\">>}=>1, K =>1, \"b\"=> 2},
  853:                  M1#{#{\"a\"=><<\"b\">>}:=3, K=>2}.
  854:              
  855:              baz7(M,K) ->
  856:                  M1 = M#{#{<<\"a\">>=>1}=>1,
  857:                     K => 1,
  858:                     <<\"b\">>=> 2},
  859:                  M1#{#{<<\"a\">>=>1}:=3,K=>2}.
  860:           ">>,
  861:            [],
  862:            {warnings,[{{3,20},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,"a"}},
  863:                       {{6,21},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,a}},
  864:                       {{9,21},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,<<"a">>}},
  865:                       {{14,20},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,{"a",1}}},
  866:                       {{17,21},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,{"a",<<"b">>}}},
  867:                       {{21,21},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,{<<"a">>,1}}},
  868:                       {{25,20},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,#{"a" => 1}}},
  869:                       {{28,21},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,#{"a" => <<"b">>}}},
  870:                       {{32,21},v3_core,{map_key_repeated,#{<<"a">> => 1}}}
  871:                      ]}}

  891:            <<"

  893:                  case X == 0 of
  894:                      false -> no;
  895:                      false -> no;
  896:                      true -> yes
  897:                  end.

  903: 
  904: underscore(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  905:     %% The code template.
  906:     S0 = <<"
  907:             f(A) ->
  908:               _VAR1 = <<A>>,
  909:               _VAR2 = {ok,A},
  910:               _VAR3 = [A],
  911:               ok.
  912:             g(A) ->
  913:               _VAR1 = A/0,
  914:               _VAR2 = date(),
  915:               ok.
  916:             h() ->
  917:                _VAR1 = fun() -> ok end,
  918:               ok.
  919:             i(A) ->
  920:                _VAR1 = #{A=>42},
  921:               ok.
  922: 	 ">>,
  923: 
  924:     %% Define all possible warnings.
  925:     Warnings = [{{3,23},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}},
  926:                 {{4,23},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}},
  927:                 {{5,23},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}},
  928:                 {{8,24},sys_core_fold,{ignored,{result,{erlang,'/',2}}}},
  929:                 {{9,23},sys_core_fold,{ignored,{no_effect,{erlang,date,0}}}},
  930:                 {{12,24},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}},
  931:                 {{15,24},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}}],
  932: 
  933: 
  934:     %% Compile the unmodified template. Assigning to variable that
  935:     %% begins with '_' should suppress all warnings.
  936:     Ts0 = [{underscore0,S0,[],[]}],
  937:     [] = run(Config, Ts0),
  938: 
  939:     %% Replace all "_VAR<digit>" variables with a plain underscore.
  940:     %% There should still be no warnings.
  941:     S1 = re:replace(S0, "_VAR\\d+", "_", [global]),
  942:     io:format("~s\n", [S1]),
  943:     Ts1 = [{underscore1,S1,[],[]}],
  944:     [] = run(Config, Ts1),
  945: 
  946:     %% Make sure that we get warnings if we remove "_VAR<digit> = ".
  947:     S2 = re:replace(S0, "_VAR\\d = ", "        ", [global]),
  948:     io:format("~s\n", [S2]),
  949:     Ts2 = [{underscore2,S2,[],{warnings,Warnings}}],
  950:     [] = run(Config, Ts2),
  951: 
  952:     %% We should also get warnings if we assign to a variables that don't
  953:     %% begin with underscore (as well as warnings for unused variables from
  954:     %% erl_lint).
  955:     S3 = re:replace(S0, "_(?=VAR\\d+)", " ", [global]),
  956:     io:format("~s\n", [S3]),
  957:     Ts3 = [{underscore2,S3,[],{warnings,Warnings}}],
  958:     [] = run(Config, Ts3),
  959: 
  960:     ok.
  961: 
  962: no_warnings(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  963:     Ts = [{no_warnings,
  964:            <<"-record(r, {s=ordsets:new(),a,b}).
  965: 
  966:               a() ->
  967:                 R = #r{},			%No warning expected.
  968:                 {R#r.a,R#r.b}.
  969: 
  970:               b(X) ->
  971:                 T = true,
  972:                 Var = [X],			%No warning expected.
  973:                 case T of
  974: 	          false -> Var;
  975:                   true -> []
  976:                 end.
  977: 
  978:               c() ->
  979:                 R0 = {r,\"abc\",undefined,os:timestamp()}, %No warning.
  980:                 case R0 of
  981: 	          {r,V1,_V2,V3} -> {r,V1,\"def\",V3}
  982:                 end.
  983: 
  984:               d(In0, Bool) ->
  985:                 {In1,Int} = case id(Bool) of
  986:                               false -> {In0,0}
  987:                             end,
  988:                 [In1,Int].
  989: 
  990:               id(I) -> I.
  991:            ">>,
  992:            [],
  993:            []}],
  994:     run(Config, Ts),
  995:     ok.
  996: 
  997: bit_syntax(Config) ->
  998:     Ts = [{?FUNCTION_NAME,
  999:            <<"
 1000:               a(<<-1>>) -> ok;
 1001:               a(<<1023>>) -> ok;
 1002:               a(<<777/signed>>) -> ok;
 1003:               a(<<a/binary>>) -> ok;
 1004:               a(<<a/integer>>) -> ok;
 1005:               a(<<a/float>>) -> ok;
 1006:               a(<<a/utf8>>) -> ok;
 1007:               a(<<a/utf16>>) -> ok;
 1008:               a(<<a/utf32>>) -> ok;
 1009:               a(<<a/utf32>>) -> ok.
 1010:               b(Bin) -> Sz = bad, <<42:Sz>> = Bin.
 1011:               c(Sz, Bin) ->
 1012:                 case Bin of
 1013:                   <<-42:Sz/unsigned>> -> ok;
 1014:                   <<42:Sz/float>> -> ok;
 1015:                   <<42:Sz/binary>> -> ok
 1016:                 end.
 1017:               d(<<16#110000/utf8>>) -> error;
 1018:               d(_) -> ok.
 1019:              ">>,
 1020: 	   [],
 1021:            {warnings,[{{2,15},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,no_clause}},
 1022:                       {{2,19},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{bit_syntax_unsigned,-1}}},
 1023:                       {{3,19},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{bit_syntax_truncated,
 1024:                                              unsigned,1023,8}}},
 1025:                       {{4,19},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{bit_syntax_truncated,
 1026:                                              signed,777,8}}},
 1027:                       {{5,19},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{bit_syntax_type,a,binary}}},
 1028:                       {{6,19},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{bit_syntax_type,a,integer}}},
 1029:                       {{7,19},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{bit_syntax_type,a,float}}},
 1030:                       {{8,19},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{bit_syntax_type,a,utf8}}},
 1031:                       {{9,19},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{bit_syntax_type,a,utf16}}},
 1032:                       {{10,19},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{bit_syntax_type,a,utf32}}},
 1033:                       {{11,19},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{bit_syntax_type,a,utf32}}},
 1034:                       {{12,35},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,no_clause}},
 1035:                       {{12,37},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{bit_syntax_size,bad}}},
 1036:                       {{15,21},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{bit_syntax_unsigned,-42}}},
 1037:                       {{17,21},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{bit_syntax_type,42,binary}}},
 1038:                       {{19,19},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{bit_syntax_unicode,1114112}}}
 1039:                      ]}
 1040:           }],
 1041:     run(Config, Ts),
 1042:     ok.
 1043: 
 1044: inlining(Config) ->
 1045:     %% Make sure that no spurious warnings are generated
 1046:     %% when inlining.
 1047:     Ts = [{inlining_1,
 1048:            <<"-compile(inline).
 1049:               compute1(X) -> add(X, 0).
 1050:               add(1, 0) -> 1;
 1051:               add(1, Y) -> 1 + Y;
 1052:               add(X, Y) -> X + Y.
 1053:            ">>,
 1054:            [],
 1055:            []},
 1056: 	  {inlining_2,
 1057:            <<"-compile({inline,[add/2]}).
 1058:               compute1(X) -> add(X, 0).
 1059:               add(1, 0) -> 1;
 1060:               add(1, Y) -> 1 + Y;
 1061:               add(X, Y) -> X + Y.
 1062:            ">>,
 1063:            [],
 1064:            []}
 1065: 	 ],
 1066:     run(Config, Ts),
 1067:     ok.
 1068: 
 1069: tuple_calls(Config) ->
 1070:     %% Make sure that no spurious warnings are generated.
 1071:     Ts = [{inlining_1,
 1072:            <<"-compile(tuple_calls).
 1073:               dispatch(X) ->
 1074:                 (list_to_atom(\"prefix_\" ++
 1075:                 atom_to_list(suffix))):doit(X).
 1076:            ">>,
 1077:            [],
 1078:            []}
 1079: 	 ],
 1080:     run(Config, Ts),
 1081:     ok.
 1082: 
 1083: recv_opt_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1084:     Code = <<"
 1085:                 simple_receive() ->
 1086:                     receive
 1087:                         Message -> handle:msg(Message)
 1088:                     end.
 1089: 
 1090:                 selective_receive(Tag, Message) ->
 1091:                     receive
 1092:                         {Tag, Message} -> handle:msg(Message)
 1093:                     end.
 1094: 
 1095:                 cross_function_receive() ->
 1096:                     cross_function_receive_1(make_ref()).
 1097: 
 1098:                 cross_function_receive_1(Tag) ->
 1099:                     receive
 1100:                         {Tag, Message} -> handle:msg(Message)
 1101:                     end.
 1102: 
 1103:                 optimized_receive(Process, Request) ->
 1104:                     MRef = monitor(process, Process),
 1105:                     Process ! {self(), MRef, Request},
 1106:                     receive
 1107:                         {MRef, Reply} ->
 1108:                             erlang:demonitor(MRef, [flush]),
 1109:                             handle:reply(Reply);
 1110:                         {'DOWN', MRef, _, _, Reason} ->
 1111:                             handle:error(Reason)
 1112:                     end.
 1113:            ">>,
 1114: 
 1115:     Ws = (catch run_test(Config, Code, [recv_opt_info])),
 1116: 
 1117:     %% This is an inexact match since the pass reports exact instructions as
 1118:     %% part of the warnings, which may include annotations that vary from run
 1119:     %% to run.
 1120:     {warnings,
 1121:         [%% simple_receive/0
 1122:          {3,beam_ssa_recv,matches_any_message},
 1123:          %% selective_receive/2
 1124:          {8,beam_ssa_recv,unoptimized_selective_receive},
 1125:          {13,beam_ssa_recv,reserved_receive_marker},
 1126:          %% cross_function_receive/0
 1127:          {13,beam_ssa_recv,{passed_marker,_}},
 1128:          %% cross_function_receive_1/1
 1129:          {16,beam_ssa_recv,{used_receive_marker,{parameter,1}}},
 1130:          %% optimized_receive/2
 1131:          {21,beam_ssa_recv,reserved_receive_marker},
 1132:          {23,beam_ssa_recv,{used_receive_marker,_}}]} = Ws,
 1133: 
 1134:     %% For coverage: don't give the recv_opt_info option.
 1135:     [] = (catch run_test(Config, Code, [])),
 1136: 
 1137:     %% Now try with abstract code and no location.
 1138:     %%
 1139:     %% simple_receive() ->
 1140:     %%     receive
 1141:     %%         Message -> handle:msg(Message)
 1142:     %%     end.
 1143:     Forms = [{attribute,0,module,nolocation_recv},
 1144:              {attribute,0,export,[{t1,0}]},
 1145:              {function,0,t1,0,
 1146:                  [{clause,0,[],[],
 1147:                       [{'receive',0,
 1148:                            [{clause,0,
 1149:                                 [{var,0,'Msg'}],
 1150:                                 [],
 1151:                                 [{call,0,
 1152:                                      {remote,0,{atom,0,handle},{atom,0,msg}},
 1153:                                      [{var,0,'Msg'}]}]}]}]}]}
 1154:     ],
 1155: 
 1156:     Wsf = (catch run_forms(Forms, [recv_opt_info])),
 1157:     {warnings, [{none,beam_ssa_recv,matches_any_message}]} = Wsf,
 1158: 
 1159:     ok.
 1160: 
 1161: %% OTP-17260: Test that opportunistic warnings can be disabled.
 1162: opportunistic_warnings(Config) ->
 1163:     Source = <<"m(_) -> ok;
 1164:                 m(_) -> error.
 1165: 
 1166:                 a() -> <<0.5>>.
 1167:                 b() -> Bin = <<1,2,3,7:4>>, <<Bin/binary>>.
 1168:                 c() -> Size = bad_size, <<1:Size>>.
 1169: 
 1170:                 i() -> {a,b,c}, ok.
 1171:            ">>,
 1172: 
 1173:     %% Don't disable any warnings.
 1174:     Ts1 = [{nothing_disabled,
 1175:             Source,
 1176:             [],
 1177:             {warnings,[{{2,17},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{shadow,1,{m,1}}}},
 1178:                        {{4,24},v3_core,{failed,bad_binary}},
 1179:                        {{5,45},sys_core_fold,{failed,{embedded_unit,8,28}}},
 1180:                        {{6,43},beam_core_to_ssa,{failed,bad_segment_size}},
 1181:                        {{8,24},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}}
 1182:                       ]}}],
 1183:     [] = run(Config, Ts1),
 1184: 
 1185:     %% Disable all opportunistic warnings.
 1186:     Ts2 = [{all_disabled,
 1187:             Source,
 1188:             [nowarn_opportunistic],
 1189:             []}],
 1190:     [] = run(Config, Ts2),
 1191: 
 1192:     %% Disable warnings for patterns that don't match.
 1193:     Ts3 = [{nomatch_disabled,
 1194:             Source,
 1195:             [nowarn_nomatch],
 1196:             {warnings,[{{4,24},v3_core,{failed,bad_binary}},
 1197:                        {{5,45},sys_core_fold,{failed,{embedded_unit,8,28}}},
 1198:                        {{6,43},beam_core_to_ssa,{failed,bad_segment_size}},
 1199:                        {{8,24},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}}
 1200:                       ]}}],
 1201:     [] = run(Config, Ts3),
 1202: 
 1203:     %% Disable warnings for failures.
 1204:     Ts4 = [{failures_disabled,
 1205:             Source,
 1206:             [nowarn_failed],
 1207:             {warnings,[{{2,17},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{shadow,1,{m,1}}}},
 1208:                        {{8,24},sys_core_fold,{ignored,useless_building}}
 1209:                       ]}}],
 1210:     [] = run(Config, Ts4),
 1211: 
 1212:     %% Disable warnings for useless building.
 1213:     Ts5 = [{disabled_useless_building,
 1214:             Source,
 1215:             [nowarn_ignored],
 1216:             {warnings,[{{2,17},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{shadow,1,{m,1}}}},
 1217:                        {{4,24},v3_core,{failed,bad_binary}},
 1218:                        {{5,45},sys_core_fold,{failed,{embedded_unit,8,28}}},
 1219:                        {{6,43},beam_core_to_ssa,{failed,bad_segment_size}}
 1220:                       ]}}],
 1221:     [] = run(Config, Ts5),
 1222: 
 1223:     %% Disable warnings for useless building and failures.
 1224:     Ts6 = [{disabled_combination,
 1225:             Source,
 1226:             [nowarn_ignored,nowarn_failed],
 1227:             {warnings,[{{2,17},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,{shadow,1,{m,1}}}}
 1228:                       ]}}],
 1229:     [] = run(Config, Ts6),
 1230: 
 1231: 
 1232:     ok.
 1233: 
 1234: %% Test value-based error handling (EEP 49).
 1235: eep49(Config) ->
 1236:     Ts = [{basic,
 1237:            <<"foo(X) ->
 1238:                   maybe
 1239:                       %% There should be no warning.
 1240:                       Always ?= X,
 1241:                       Always
 1242:                   end.
 1243:            ">>,
 1244:            [{feature,maybe_expr,enable}],
 1245:            []},
 1246:           {disabled,
 1247:            <<"foo() -> maybe.                        %Atom maybe.
 1248:            ">>,
 1249:            [{feature,maybe_expr,disable}],
 1250:            []}
 1251: 	 ],
 1252:     run(Config, Ts),
 1253:     ok.
 1254: 
 1255: %% GH-6158: There would be a warning for a clause that could not match.
 1256: inline_list_funcs(Config) ->
 1257:     Ts = [{basic,
 1258:            <<"all(L) ->
 1259:                   lists:all(fun erlang:is_integer/1, L).
 1260:               any(L) ->
 1261:                   lists:any(fun erlang:is_integer/1, L).
 1262:               foreach(L) ->
 1263:                   lists:foreach(fun erlang:is_integer/1, L).
 1264:               map(L) ->
 1265:                   lists:map(fun erlang:abs/1, L).
 1266:               filter(L) ->
 1267:                   lists:map(fun erlang:is_integer/1, L).
 1268:               foldl(L) ->
 1269:                   lists:foldl(fun erlang:is_function/2, L).
 1270:               foldr(L) ->
 1271:                   lists:foldl(fun erlang:is_function/2, L).
 1272:               mapfoldl(L) ->
 1273:                   lists:mapfoldl(fun erlang:is_function/2, L).
 1274:               mapfoldr(L) ->
 1275:                   lists:mapfoldr(fun erlang:is_function/2, L).
 1276:               ">>,
 1277:            [inline_list_funcs],
 1278:            []}
 1279:          ],
 1280:     run(Config, Ts),
 1281: 
 1282:     ok.
 1283: 
 1284: 
 1285: %%%
 1286: %%% End of test cases.
 1287: %%%
 1288: 
 1289: run(Config, Tests0) ->
 1290:     do_run(Config, Tests0),
 1291: 
 1292:     %% Now test without column numbers.
 1293:     Tests = [lines_only(T) || T <- Tests0],
 1294:     do_run(Config, Tests).
 1295: 
 1296: lines_only({Name,Test,Opts,{warnings,Result0}}) ->
 1297:     Result1 = lists:map(fun lines_only_1/1, Result0),
 1298:     Result = {warnings,lists:usort(Result1)},
 1299:     {Name,Test,[{error_location,line}|Opts],Result};
 1300: lines_only(NoWarnings) -> NoWarnings.
 1301: 
 1302: lines_only_1({File,Es0}) when is_list(Es0) ->
 1303:     Es = [lines_only_1(E) || E <- Es0],
 1304:     {File,Es};
 1305: lines_only_1({Loc,Mod,Error}) ->
 1306:     case Loc of
 1307:         {Line,_Col} ->
 1308:             {Line,Mod,Error};
 1309:         Line when is_integer(Line) ->
 1310:             {Line,Mod,Error}
 1311:     end.
 1312: 
 1313: do_run(Config, Tests) ->
 1314:     F = fun({N,P,Ws,E}, BadL) ->
 1315:                 io:format("### ~s\n", [N]),
 1316:                 case catch run_test(Config, P, Ws) of
 1317:                     E -> 
 1318:                         BadL;
 1319:                     Bad -> 
 1320:                         io:format("~nTest ~p failed. Expected~n  ~p~n"
 1321:                                   "but got~n  ~p~n", [N, E, Bad]),
 1322: 			fail()
 1323:                 end
 1324:         end,
 1325:     lists:foldl(F, [], Tests).
 1326: 
 1327: %% Compiles a test module and returns the list of errors and warnings.
 1328: 
 1329: run_test(Conf, Test0, Warnings) ->
 1330:     Module = "warnings" ++ test_lib:uniq(),
 1331:     Filename = Module ++ ".erl",
 1332:     DataDir = ?privdir,
 1333:     Test1 = ["-module(", Module, "). -file( \"", Filename, "\", 1). ", Test0],
 1334:     Test = iolist_to_binary(Test1),
 1335:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Filename),
 1336:     Opts = [binary,export_all,return|Warnings],
 1337:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 1338: 
 1339:     %% Compile once just to print all warnings (and cover more code).
 1340:     compile:file(File, [binary,export_all,report|Warnings]),
 1341: 
 1342:     %% Test result of compilation.
 1343:     Res = get_warnings(compile:file(File, Opts)),
 1344:     case Res of
 1345:         [] -> [];
 1346:         {warnings, Ws} -> print_warnings(Ws, Test)
 1347:     end,
 1348:     file:delete(File),
 1349:     Res.
 1350: 
 1351: run_forms(Forms, Warnings) ->
 1352:     get_warnings(compile:forms(Forms, [binary,return|Warnings])).
 1353: 
 1354: get_warnings(Result) ->
 1355:     case Result of
 1356:         {ok, _M, Bin, []} when is_binary(Bin) ->
 1357:             [];
 1358:         {ok, _M, Bin, Ws0} when is_binary(Bin) ->
 1359:             %% We are not interested in warnings from
 1360:             %% erl_lint here.
 1361:             WsL = [{F,[W || {_,Mod,_}=W <- Ws,
 1362:                             Mod =/= erl_lint]} ||
 1363:                       {F,Ws} <- Ws0],
 1364:             case WsL of
 1365:                 [{_File,Ws}] -> {warnings, Ws};
 1366:                 _ -> list_to_tuple([warnings, WsL])
 1367:             end
 1368:     end.
 1369: 
 1370: print_warnings(Warnings, Source) ->
 1371:     Lines = binary:split(Source, <<"\n">>, [global]),
 1372:     Cs = [print_warning(W, Lines) || W <- Warnings],
 1373:     io:put_chars(Cs),
 1374:     ok.
 1375: 
 1376: print_warning({{LineNum,Column},Mod,Data}, Lines) ->
 1377:     Line0 = lists:nth(LineNum, Lines),
 1378:     <<Line1:(Column-1)/binary,_/binary>> = Line0,
 1379:     Spaces = re:replace(Line1, <<"[^\t]">>, <<" ">>, [global]),
 1380:     CaretLine = [Spaces,"^"],
 1381:     [io_lib:format("~p:~p: ~ts\n",
 1382:                    [LineNum,Column,Mod:format_error(Data)]),
 1383:      Line0, "\n",
 1384:      CaretLine, "\n\n"];
 1385: print_warning(_, _) ->
 1386:     [].
 1387: 
 1388: fail() ->
 1389:     ct:fail(failed).
